indicator_name: Proportion of domestic budget funded by domestic taxes
target_name: Strengthen domestic resource mobilization, including through international support to developing countries, to improve domestic capacity for tax and other revenue collection
goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals metadata for target 17.1
computation_definitions: The precise definition of the indicator is the proportion of domestic budgetary central government expenditure funded by taxes. Revenue in the form of domestic taxes is based on the definition described in Chapter 5 of the Government Finance Statistics Manual (GFSM) 2014 (PDF, 4.7MB).
computation_calculations: (Government taxes / (expenses + net investment in non-financial assets)) * 100
graph_title: Percentage of government expenditure funded by domestic taxes
source_url_text_1: International Monetary Fund’s Government Finance Statistics framework in the public sector finances - Appendix E
source_next_release_1: 23/01/2023: We plan to update indicator data within 4 months of data being released
source_other_info_1:
General government data are acquired from tab SO-GG, Code 11 Total Taxes, Code 2 Expense, and Code 31 Net investments in non-financial assets.

Please note that although this source is updated on monthly basis, the indicator is updated annually.
other_info:
The government expenditure data used for the calculations is based on the IMF’s Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014 (GFSM). See the International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics framework in the public sector finances for more information.

Data follows the UN specification for this indicator. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
